comments.body: Are the two overrides here a copy & paste error?

Hello @orta , there is no copy paste error.
I can tell you that executing `npm test bero` with the suggested default `tslint.json` I've this error reported as outuput:

```
ERROR: 1:1  npm-naming  The declaration doesn't match the JavaScript module 'bero'. Reason:
The declaration should use 'export =' syntax because the JavaScript source uses 'module.exports =' syntax and 'module.exports' can be called or constructed.

To learn more about 'export =' syntax, see https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/modules.html#export--and-import--require.
If you won't fix this error now or you think this error is wrong,
you can disable this check by adding the following options to your project's tslint.json file under "rules":

    "npm-naming": [true,{"mode":"code","errors":[["NeedsExportEquals",false]]}]
 See: https://github.com/Microsoft/dtslint/blob/master/docs/npm-naming.md
```

So, following the suggestion here for the `tslint.json`, the error got fixed.
@orta it is not in progress, for me it is the final version, possibly to be merged
